name: left-pad
description: String left pad - The infamous package that broke the internet when unpublished
reason: Historical significance - caused massive NPM ecosystem disruption. Now archived with no maintenance.

name: colors.js
description: Get colors in your node.js console
reason: Sabotaged by maintainer with infinite loop. Millions of downloads per week but now unmaintained.

name: node-uuid
description: Simple, fast generation of RFC4122 UUIDS
reason: Deprecated in favor of 'uuid' package. Many projects still depend on this unmaintained version.

name: request
reason: Officially deprecated. Still has 16M+ weekly downloads but no security updates since 2020.

name: bower
description: A package manager for the web
reason: Deprecated package manager. Projects still using it face compatibility issues with modern tooling.

name: gulp
reason: While not officially abandoned, development has stalled. Most modern projects use Webpack/Vite instead.

name: moment.js
description: Parse, validate, manipulate, and display dates in javascript
reason: In maintenance mode. Docs recommend using modern alternatives like date-fns or Luxon for new projects.

name: core-js
reason: Maintainer burnout and funding issues. Critical infrastructure used by billions of websites.

name: event-stream
description: EventStream is like functional programming meets IO
reason: Compromised by malicious code injection in 2018. Now abandoned with known security vulnerabilities.

name: node-sass
reason: Deprecated in favor of Dart Sass. Native binding issues cause installation problems on modern systems.
